rule.title: Board:
rule.description: Composed of nine tic-tac-toe boards arranged in a 3 × 3 grid.

rule.title: Objective:
rule.description: Win (align) three mini-boards in a row (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally).

rule.title: Time Limit:
rule.description: Each move must be made within 30 seconds.
Each turn, players place their mark (X or O) in one cell of a mini-board.

rule.title: Objective:
rule.description: Align three boards in a row, column, or diagonal.

rule.title: Ultimate Rule:
rule.description: The game starts with X playing wherever they want in any of the 81 empty spots. Next, the opponent plays, but they are forced to play in the small board corresponding to the location of the previous move, relative to the small board in which it was played.

rule.title: What happens when a player wins a smaller board?
rule.description: The entire small board is marked as won by the player in the larger board. Once a small board is won or filled, no more moves may be played there. If sent to such a board, the player can choose to play on any other board.

rule.title: Game End:
rule.description: Gameplay ends when either a player wins the larger board or there are no legal moves left, resulting in a draw.
The player that plays the first move always has an advantage in this game and is the favorite to win (assuming perfect play).
Game openings and strategies are much more complex in this variant of Tic-Tac-Toe, as each move is crucial to the outcome of the large board.
There are no defined/clear strategies and openings, so the only way to master XO² is by practicing. Good luck! :)
